Based on your preference for mockumentary films, I'd highly recommend "A Mighty Wind"! This delightful comedy stars a talented ensemble cast including Eugene Levy, Christopher Guest, and Catherine O'Hara, and follows the preparation for a reunion concert that leads to some unexpected and hilarious situations.

If you're open to a more unique blend of humor and drama, "Afterlife" might also be worth checking out. This heartwarming film features a neurotic young man who begins to see his father's ghost, leading to an emotional journey towards understanding each other that they never had in life. Enjoy the movies!

Another documentary that might resonate with you is "Tarnation". This film offers a unique and personal insight into the life of filmmaker Jonathan Caouette, growing up with his schizophrenic mother. It's a moving exploration of family dynamics and mental health issues. Enjoy your viewing!
